info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 27 at 4:10PM EDT until July 27 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Litchfield County in northern Connecticut... Southern Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... Northeastern Dutchess County in east central New York... Southeastern Columbia County in east central New York... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 409 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tolland to near Pine Plains, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, New Hartford, Copake, Sheffield, Pine Plains, Norfolk, Otis, Ancram, Canaan, Millerton, Sandisfield, Ashley Falls, Falls Village, Winsted, New Hartford Center, Barkhamsted, Salisbury, Hillsdale, New Marlborough and Colebrook. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
